title: She elephant falls into Z-D canal; saved after three-hour operation
byline: A she elephant that fell into the Z-D canal in Welikanda this morning was saved by the Wildlife officers and driven away into a forest reserve after a three hour rescue operation.

title: Colombo stock market ends in red after extended bull run
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) witnessed a reversal in momentum today, breaking its recent bullish streak as investor sentiment shifted during midday trading. The market, which opened on a positive note, saw the All Share Price Index (ASPI) gain 82 points early in the session before reversing sharply, declining by 179 points to close the day lower by 80 points.

title: Ishara Sewwandi brought back
byline: Ishara Sewwandi, the main suspect in the murder of Ganemulla Sanjeewa and the other suspects, were brought back to the country a short while ago.

title: Manusha Nanayakkara released on bail
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara was released on bail by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanka S. Bodaragama today.

title: PC polls to be held either under old system or after enacting new electoral system: Lal Kantha
byline: While reiterating government’s assurance to hold the Provincial Council elections next year, Minister Lal Kantha said the election will be held next year either under the old system or after enacting a new electoral system.

title: New secretaries appointed to two Ministries
byline: Two new secretaries have been appointed to the Ministry of Ports and Civil Aviation and the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs by the President.

title: Government dispensers to launch island-wide strike on Oct. 22
byline: The Society of Government Dispensers has announced that it will launch an island-wide strike on Wednesday (22), protesting the failure to recruit dispensing officers to major government hospitals managed by the central government and opposing what they described as unfair interference in transfer decisions made by the Health Ministry.

title: Traffic disruptions due to dense fog in central hills
byline: Traffic disruptions have occurred in the catchment areas on the western slopes of the central hills due to dense fog and heavy rains which lashed the area this afternoon.

title: Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayaka released on bail
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake, President of the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court Bar Association, was released on bail today over allegations of verbally abusing and threatening a police officer who was on duty within the court premises.

title: CID ordered to verify quality of creams marketed by Piumi Hansamali
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Nuwan Kaushalya today directed the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to obtain a report from the Government Analyst regarding the quality standards of cosmetic creams distributed islandwide by Loliya Skin Company, owned by popular actress and model Piumi Hansamali.

title: UNP officially calls all Opposition political parties to unite
byline: The United National Party (UNP), in an official statement, called on all Opposition political parties to come to a single platform while safeguarding their own identities.
